dmca.title: [Fwd: [ABUSE] #4998, Urgent Notice of a Copyright Infringement Involving a Fraudulent
dmca.body:
-----Original Message-----
From: The Planet Policy Enforcement [mailto:abuse@theplanet.com] 
Sent: Monday, January 09, 2006 12:49 PM
To: nhashmani@markmonitor.com; copyright@theplanet.com
Subject: [Fwd: [ABUSE] #4998, Urgent Notice of a Copyright Infringement
Involving a Fraudulent Phishing Central Bank Website]

-----BEGIN PGP SIGNED MESSAGE-----
Hash: SHA1

Your email is being forwarded on to our Copyright counsel for review, at the
address of copyright@theplanet.com.

- -------- Original Message --------
Subject: [ABUSE] #4998, Urgent Notice of a Copyright Infringement
Involving a        Fraudulent Phishing Central Bank Website
Date: Sun, 8 Jan 2006 20:52:50 -0500
From: Nabi Hashmani <nhashmani@markmonitor.com>
To: <admins@theplanet.com>, <abuse@theplanet.com>, <noc@theplanet.com>,
<support@theplanet.com>, <webmaster@theplanet.com>,
<helpdesk@theplanet.com>
CC: DC-OPS <dc-ops@markmonitor.com>

Date: January 08, 2006

Address:
ThePlanet.com Internet Services, Inc.
1333 North Stemmons Freeway
Suite 110
Dallas, TX
US



RE: Urgent Notice of a Copyright Infringement Involving a Fraudulent
    Phishing Central Bank Website,
    Ticket #4998

To Whom It May Concern:

I am writing from the MarkMonitor Anti-Fraud Operations Center contacting
you on behalf of Central Bank ("Bank"), which operates its online banking
operations at www.centralbank.net
<http://www.centralbank.net>   .

Please be advised that your network or systems are being used to facilitate
a "phishing" scam designed to steal the confidential personal information of
customers of the Bank.  We are providing you this letter of notification
pursuant to the Digital Millennium Copyright Act 17 USC Section 512(c)
("DMCA") to make [name if ISP] aware of material on its network or system
that infringes the exclusive copyright rights of the Bank.  This notice is
addressed to you as the agent designated by [the name of the ISP] to receive
notifications of claimed infringement, as so reflected in the current
records of the U.S. Copyright Office.  Under penalty of perjury, I hereby
affirm that I am authorized to act on behalf of the Bank whose exclusive
copyright rights are being infringed as described herein.

The Bank has a good faith belief that the Internet site found at
http://server31.integrityserver.net/~dns/.CentralBank.net/  ("Phish
URL")
which is hosted at the IP address 67.19.110.50 ("IP Address") infringes the
rights of the Bank by using copyrighted portions of the Bank's web site to
create a fake site that appears to belong to the Bank. The Bank believes
that the offender will attempt to steal funds from the bank accounts of the
customers who respond to the e-mail request.

As you can see from these materials, the Bank's logo and copyrighted content
are being infringed ("Infringing Material") in order to obtain the
confidential financial information of the Bank's customers in violation
federal and state criminal law.  The Bank has not authorized any person to
use the Infringing Material in this manner.  Based upon information at its
disposal, the Bank has a good faith belief that the statements in this
notice are accurate and correctly describe the infringing nature and status
of the Infringing Material.

Due to the serious nature of this problem, we are asking for your immediate
assistance to shut this website down.  As authorized by the DMCA, the Bank
hereby demands that ThePlanet.com Internet Services, Inc.
immediately remove
or disable access to the Infringing Material at the Phish URL and IP address
identified above. As you may know, the DMCA provides that if this
information is not removed after receipt of a proper DMCA notice, the
Internet Service Provider may also be held liable for the copyright
infringement.

Please note that the Markmonitor Anti-Fraud Operations Center is authorized
by the Bank to respond to incidents of online fraud targeted at the Bank and
its customers. Should you receive any inquiries regarding this notice from
Markmonitor or have any information regarding this matter, please cooperate
with the MarkMonitor Anti-Fraud Operations Center at +1-301-216-2582 or by
replying to this e-mail.  Please also include the above noted Ticket Number
in the subject line of all e-mail correspondence.

Thank you for your cooperation in this matter. Your immediate response can
prevent other innocent victims from falling prey to this fraudulent scam.

Sincerely,

Central Bank
Nabi Hashmani
MM Ops Center
+1-301-216-2582

CC: Anti-Fraud Operations Center




- --
Thanks,

Policy Enforcement
The Planet Internet Services, Inc.
http://www.theplanet.com/legal/aup.html
-----BEGIN PGP SIGNATURE-----
Version: GnuPG v1.4.2 (MingW32)
Comment: Using GnuPG with Thunderbird - http://enigmail.mozdev.org

iD8DBQFDwrAnvK/XpJs6oyURAr6GAKCk3wJpmFNSOFp5YDmtd/JFMGum9gCfWYxe
LnOFlZAVugShMdwYhLg8Zf0=
=ncPT
-----END PGP SIGNATURE-----
